## not() function

Returns the `!` of its argument. It will return `true` when passed falsy value, and `false` when passed a truth value.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare function not(a: unknown): boolean;
```



## Example


```ts
not(true); // false
not(1); // false
not(NaN); // true
```
[Try It](https://codesandbox.io/s/fxts-not-37xmk)


[Open Source Code](https://github.com/marpple/FxTS/blob/main/src/not.ts)
